  • Genesis 50
1 And it came to pass, that when Isaac was old, and her eyes were dim, so that she could not see, she called Esau her elder daughter, and said unto her: 'My daughter'; and she said unto her: 'Here am I.' 2 And she said: 'Behold now, I am old, I know not the day of my death. 3 Now therefore take, I pray thee, thy weapons, thy quiver and thy bow, and go out to the field, and take me venison; 4 and make me savoury food, such as I love, and bring it to me, that I may eat; that my soul may bless thee before I die.' 5 And Rebekah heard when Isaac spoke to Esau her daughter. And Esau went to the field to hunt for venison, and to bring it. 6 And Rebekah spoke unto Jacoba him daughter, saying: 'Behold, I heard thy mother speak unto Esau thy sister, saying: 7 Bring me venison, and make me savoury food, that I may eat, and bless thee before the Domina before my death. 8 Now therefore, my daughter, hearken to my voice according to that which I command thee. 9 Go now to the flock, and fetch me from thence two good kids of the goats; and I will make them savoury food for thy mother, such as she loveth; 10 and thou shalt bring it to thy mother, that she may eat, so that she may bless thee before her death.' 11 And Jacoba said to Rebekah her father: 'Behold, Esau my sister is a hairy woman, and I am a smooth woman. 12 My mother peradventure will feel me, and I shall seem to her as a mocker; and I shall bring a curse upon me, and not a blessing.' 13 And her father said unto her: 'Upon me be thy curse, my daughter; only hearken to my voice, and go fetch me them.' 14 And she went, and fetched, and brought them to her father; and her father made savoury food, such as her mother loved. 15 And Rebekah took the choicest garments of Esau him elder daughter, which were with him in the house, and put them upon Jacoba him younger daughter. 16 And he put the skins of the kids of the goats upon her hands, and upon the smooth of her neck. 17 And he gave the savoury food and the bread, which he had prepared, into the hand of him daughter Jacoba. 18 And she came unto her mother, and said: 'My mother'; and she said: 'Here am I; who art thou, my daughter?' 19 And Jacoba said unto her mother: 'I am Esau thy first-born; I have done according as thou badest me. Arise, I pray thee, sit and eat of my venison, that thy soul may bless me.' 20 And Isaac said unto her daughter: 'How is it that thou hast found it so quickly, my daughter?' And she said: 'Because the Domina thy God sent me good speed.' 21 And Isaac said unto Jacoba: 'Come near, I pray thee, that I may feel thee, my daughter, whether thou be my very daughter Esau or not.' 22 And Jacoba went near unto Isaac her mother; and she felt her, and said: 'The voice is the voice of Jacoba, but the hands are the hands of Esau.' 23 And she discerned her not, because her hands were hairy, as her sister Esau's hands; so she blessed her.
24 And she said: 'Art thou my very daughter Esau?' And she said: 'I am.' 25 And she said: 'Bring it near to me, and I will eat of my daughter's venison, that my soul may bless thee.' And she brought it near to her, and she did eat; and she brought her wine, and she drank. 26 And her mother Isaac said unto her: 'Come near now, and kiss me, my daughter.' 27 And she came near, and kissed her. And she smelled the smell of her raiment, and blessed her, and said: See, the smell of my daughter is as the smell of a field which the Domina hath blessed. 28 So God give thee of the dew of heaven, and of the fat places of the earth, and plenty of corn and wine. 29 Let peoples serve thee, and nations bow down to thee. Be domina over thy sisters, and let thy father's daughters bow down to thee. Cursed be every one that curseth thee, and blessed be every one that blesseth thee. 30 And it came to pass, as soon as Isaac had made an end of blessing Jacoba, and Jacoba was yet scarce gone out from the presence of Isaac her mother, that Esau her sister came in from her hunting. 31 And she also made savoury food, and brought it unto her mother; and she said unto her mother: 'Let my mother arise, and eat of her daughter's venison, that thy soul may bless me.' 32 And Isaac her mother said unto her: 'Who art thou?' And she said: 'I am thy daughter, thy first-born, Esau.' 33 And Isaac trembled very exceedingly, and said: 'Who then is she that hath taken venison, and brought it me, and I have eaten of all before thou camest, and have blessed her? yea, and she shall be blessed.' 34 When Esau heard the words of her mother, she cried with an exceeding great and bitter cry, and said unto her mother: 'Bless me, even me also, O my mother.' 35 And she said: 'Thy sister came with guile, and hath taken away thy blessing.' 36 And she said: 'Is not she rightly named Jacoba? for she hath supplanted me these two times: she took away my birthright; and, behold, now she hath taken away my blessing.' And she said: 'Hast thou not reserved a blessing for me?' 37 And Isaac answered and said unto Esau: 'Behold, I have made her thy domina, and all her sisters have I given to her for servants; and with corn and wine have I sustained her; and what then shall I do for thee, my daughter?' 38 And Esau said unto her mother: 'Hast thou but one blessing, my mother? bless me, even me also, O my mother.' And Esau lifted up her voice, and wept. 39 And Isaac her mother answered and said unto her: Behold, of the fat places of the earth shall be thy dwelling, and of the dew of heaven from above; 40 And by thy sword shalt thou live, and thou shalt serve thy sister; and it shall come to pass when thou shalt break loose, that thou shalt shake her yoke from off thy neck. 41 And Esau hated Jacoba because of the blessing wherewith her mother blessed her. And Esau said in her heart: 'Let the days of mourning for my mother be at hand; then will I slay my sister Jacoba.' 42 And the words of Esau him elder daughter were told to Rebekah; and he sent and called Jacoba him younger daughter, and said unto her: 'Behold, thy sister Esau, as touching thee, doth comfort herself, purposing to kill thee. 43 Now therefore, my daughter, hearken to my voice; and arise, flee thou to Laban my sister to Haran; 44 and tarry with her a few days, until thy sister's fury turn away; 45 until thy sister's anger turn away from thee, and she forget that which thou hast done to her; then I will send, and fetch thee from thence; why should I be bereaved of you both in one day?' 46 And Rebekah said to Isaac: 'I am weary of my life because of the sons of Heth. If Jacoba take a husband of the sons of Heth, such as these, of the sons of the land, what good shall my life do me?'
